ovdesc.p: All reports that can be produced by the T24 system will be defined on this file. This includes Batch como's, P function output, FX deal slips ,and all message output from the delivery system, etc.

This file will contain a description of the report, the printer environment (form), the date and time last produced and spooled, an indicator to flag the report for micro-fiching, and a mnemonic to link it a product. If this is set a copy of the report will be taken each time it is produced and saved in a microfiche hold area.
The report name is hard-coded in the programs which produce the report. If the report name does not exist on this file then a fatal error will occur.
The definition of a new Repgen or CRF report will automatically update this file.
The routing of output to the correct printer is controlled in the following way:

1. If the report control record states the report is a customer report and the corresponding DE.ADDRESS record states output is to be held then the output will be held on the CUSTOMER.HOLD file and will not be printed unless FORCED.

2. If the report control record defines a specific form (field 3) and that form name on DE.FORM.TYPE has a default printer defined, then this printer is used regardless of any other setting. This is to allow a printer to be set up with special stationary and ensure that it receives the appropriate output.

3. If the output is produced by an on-line user then then it will be sent to the printer defined on the user record. If this is not setup then the output will go to the system printer (SYSTEM on PRINTER.ID).

4. If the output is produced as part of the batch run the reports etc will be sent to the printer defined in the Batch record. If this is not defined then it will be sent to the system printer. Another option exists (on SPF) to hold all Batch output, so that it can be spooled in sorted order (see SPOOL.BATCH.OUTPUT).
Special report attributes can be defined, i.e. adjusting the left and right margins, pitch, page orientation etc. This is primarily aimed at laser printers where these attributes are "soft".

Because different printers support different features the report attributes are specified for individual printer types. That is to say, in order to define a report to be printed in landscape mode on a QMS laser printer the following steps should be taken. 1. Set up the printer type. For all printers on your PRINTER.ID file which are QMS laser printers enter the type in field 3, eg. QMS.

2. Set up the attribute "QMS.LANDSCAPE". Define the printed sequence which will turn the QMS laser printer into landscape mode on the file PRINTER.ATTRIBUTES with a key QMS.LANDSCAPE. Also define the reset sequence so that the printer is returned to a default state.
3. Set up the report form type. Enter "LANDSCAPE" in a new or existing DE.FORM.TYPE record in the RPT.ATTRIBUTES field.
4. Link the form type to the report. Modify the report control record to use this form type.
Hence, the next time this report is spooled to a QMS printer it will be printed in landscape mode.

Note: When printing in landscape mode you must take account of the "shorter" page length. Adjust the form depth on DE.FORM.TYPE or consider adjusting the printer attributes to a smaller number of lines per inch.
